Target: OntoBMS is an ontology for Building Management Systems.

Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in a building.
Label: Building device

Comment: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) device that provides indoor environmental comfort.
Label: HVAC

Comment: A device that provide a consistent and controlled solution to replacing the air within the space.
Label: Makeup air unit

Comment: A device that condition and distribute air within a building.
Label: Air handling unit

Comment: A device that consists of a fan, a coil, and other components, that are used to cool or heat the air recirculating within a room.
Label: Fan coil unit

Comment: A Variable Air Volume System that vary the airflow at a constant or varying temperature.
Label: VAV system

Comment: A Constant Air Volume System that supply a constant airflow at a variable temperature.
Label: CAV system

Comment: A separate space provided for air circulation for heating, ventilation, and air-conditioning.
Label: Plenum

Comment: Generalization of all devices that participate in a distribution system.
Label: Distribution device

Comment: Represents devices of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power.
Label: Distribution flow device

Comment: Represents devices of a building automation control system that are used to impart control over elements of a distribution system.
Label: Distribution control device

Comment: A controller is a device that monitors inputs and controls outputs within a building automation system.
Label: Controller

Comment: A device typically used to remove unwanted matter from a fluid, either liquid or gas, and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
Label: Flow treatment device

Comment: A filter is an apparatus used to remove particulate or gaseous matter from fluids and gases.
Label: Filter

Comment: A device that uses venting and air flow to protect users from hazardous substances such as vapors, gases, and particulates.
Label: Fume hood

Comment: A type of fume hood that’s designed to vent non-toxic vapors like steam, heat and odors.
Label: Canopy hood

Comment: A larger fume hood designed to be able to house large laboratory instruments and equipment.
Label: Walk-in fume hood

Comment: A device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
Label: Energy conversion device

Comment: A coil is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media.
Label: Coil

Comment: A coil that uses water as a heat transfer medium.
Label: Water coil

Comment: A coil that uses electricity to generate heat for heat transfer purposes.
Label: Electrical coil

Comment: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.
Label: Solar device

Comment: Solar panels capture sunlight as a source of radiant energy, which is converted into electric energy in the form of direct current (DC) electricity.
Label: Solar panel

Comment: A Flow Controller defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.
Label: Flow controller

Comment: A damper typically participates in an HVAC duct distribution system and is used to control or modulate the flow of air.
Label: Damper

Comment: A valve is used in a building services piping distribution system to control or modulate the flow of the fluid.
Label: Valve

Comment: A flow moving device is used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
Label: Flow moving device

Comment: A duct is a conduit or passage used in heating, ventilation, and air conditioning to deliver and remove air.
Label: Duct

Comment: A pipe is a tubular section or hollow cylinder, usually but not necessarily of circular cross-section, used mainly to convey fluids.
Label: Pipe

Comment: A Tee is a connector between pipes to separate or combine some streams.
Label: Tee

Comment: A fan is a device which imparts mechanical work on a gas.
Label: Fan

Comment: An exhaust fan pull odors, fumes, and moisture from an area and vent them outdoors for removal.
Label: Exhaust fan

Comment: An exhaust fan that dilute and disperse potentially hazardous exhaust or fumes quickly and safely.
Label: High plume fan

Comment: A mode is an option that indicates or allow a change in the method of operation of a device.
Label: Mode

Comment: An alert status that is triggered due to an abnormal condition or change in condition.
Label: Alarm status

Comment: The current status of a damper (whether it is opened or closed etc).
Label: Damper status

Comment: Alternating Current (AC) electrical power.
Label: Electrical power (AC)

Comment: Direct Current (DC) electrical power.
Label: Electrical power (DC)

Comment: Rate of movement of air.
Label: Air flow rate

Comment: Rate of movement of water.
Label: Water flow rate

Comment: The amount of heat needed to transfer from a hot side to the cold side over a unit of time.
Label: Heat duty

Comment: A Convective Transport Rate in the most general terms refers to the movement of molecules within fluid phases which is the sum of advective and diffusive transport.
Label: Convective transport rate

Comment: A signal (pressure based) that that can be used to determine the exact position of a damper.
Label: Damper feedback

Comment: A pressure based measurement used to control the volume of air that flows through your HVAC system by providing measurements to control the damper position.
Label: Damper control

Comment: The length of opening for a sash.
Label: Sash opening

Comment: A signal (frequency based) that that can be used to determine the current state of a VSD device (fan etc).
Label: VSD feedback

Comment: A frequency based measurement used to control an AC motor's speed and torque.
Label: VSD control

Comment: The desired or target value for an essential humidity variable, or process value (PV) of a control system.
Label: Humidity set-point

Comment: The desired or target value for an essential temperature variable, or process value (PV) of a control system.
Label: Temperature set-point

Comment: The desired or target value for an essential pressure variable, or process value (PV) of a control system.
Label: Pressure set-point

Comment: A relationship that describes a device sending a signal to another device.
Label: sends signal to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device fulfilling an unit operation (Mixing, Separation etc).
Label: realizes

Comment: A relationship between a continuous material amount and its convective transport rate.
Label: has convective transport rate

Comment: A relationship that describes the heat duty involved in a temperature change process.
Label: has heat duty

Comment: A relationship that describes a heat duty being comprised of other heat duties.
Label: is composed of
